articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Helping the poor, insured during coronavirus outbreak
articles.description: Yasmin Vossoughian talks with Sen. Mark Warner (D-VA) about what can be done to help poor and uninsured people who could be disproportionately affected by the coronavirus outbreak.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Markets Dive over fears of Coronavirus
articles.description: The markets dive at the open as traders continue to be wary of uncertainty surrounding the Coronavirus. CNBC’s Sr. Markets correspondent Dom Chu and Josh Brown, CEO of Ritholtz Wealth Management tell Stephanie Ruhle how a lack of coordination and trust betwee…

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Virus expert explains how to protect yourself from coronavirus
articles.description: Virologist Joseph Fair shares his best advice for what Americans need to know about protecting themselves from the spread of the coronavirus.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Why it's not a time for Trump's hunches on coronavirus
articles.description: During a televised phone interview on Wednesday, the president discussed his hunches on the WHO's figures on the death rate from coronavirus and how some infected get better and go to work. The panel reacts to Trump's remarks.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: WA Senator Murray angered by lack of coronavirus testing
articles.description:
As Washington and California have declared states of emergency due to the coronavirus outbreak, the senate just passed 8.2 billion dollars in emergency funding to fight the outbreak. 
Washington State Democratic Senator Patty Murray joins Katy Tur to discuss …

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: California governor declares state of emergency
articles.description: California Governor Gavin Newsom has declared a state of emergency over the spread of coronavirus. The governor confirmed 53 case of the virus in the state.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Doctor set to appear on Hill over vaccine development
articles.description: Dr. Peter Hotez will be testifying before the House Science Committee on Thursday on the development of a coronavirus vaccine, and he joins Morning Joe to discuss.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Trump pushing for a coronavirus vaccine, but concerns over cost have risen
articles.description:
President Trump met with health officials to discuss speeding up the process for creating a coronavirus vaccine. 
Even when one is developed - it's still not guaranteed to be affordable for everyone.
Joining Katy Tur to discuss this is former Obama White Hous…

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Trump discovers (limited) Medicare for all amid coronavirus crisis
articles.description: Senator Bernie Sanders notes that even the Trump administration realizes the necessity of people with coronavirus symptoms being able to afford to see a doctor, and they've found a familiar solution to make that possible.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Trump contradicts health experts and officials on coronavirus
articles.description: President Trump spreads falsehoods in the face of a growing health crisis

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Chris Hayes on Trump’s failing response to coronavirus
articles.description: The government is not doing enough to protect the American people -- and the person at the top does not want to deal with the problem.

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Sanders: Trump contempt for Congress inhibits coronavirus...
articles.description: Senator Bernie Sanders, in an exclusive interview with Rachel Maddow, points out that Donald Trump's disdain for Congress is an obstacle to the U.S. government being able to implement policies to protect Americans from the spread of coronavirus.

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: De Blasio: We need federal government's help on coronavirus
articles.description: NYC Mayor Bill de Blasio joins Morning Joe to discuss the latest developments in the coronavirus and how he's working to keep the city safe.

articles.author: Msnbc
articles.title: With bogus claim, Trump tries to blame coronavirus missteps on Obama
articles.description: Trump's creepy preoccupation with Obama is taking him in a ridiculous direction on the coronavirus outbreak.
articles.content: In the wake of a series of avoidable mistakes, Donald Trump and his team have confronted quite a bit of criticism over their handling on the coronavirus outbreak. For the most part, the president has responded by arguing that the unflattering assessments are … [+3063 chars]

articles.author: Msnbc
articles.title: On coronavirus, Trump cites 'hunch' to contradict health experts
articles.description: Trump has a "hunch" that the World Health Organization's fatality statistics on the coronavirus are "false." No, seriously, that's what he said.
articles.content: In the early stages of the coronavirus outbreak, experts pointed to a mortality rate of 2.3%. This week, however, the World Health Organization pointed to an even more alarming figure. During a Tuesday press briefing, WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebr… [+2639 chars]

articles.author: Msnbc
articles.title: Trump still sees coronavirus outbreak as a public-relations problem
articles.description: Trump said he "hated" to bring Americans with the coronavirus to U.S. soil because it might "look bad" from a "statistical" perspective. That's ridiculous.
articles.content: During his latest Fox News interview, Donald Trump told Sean Hannity last night about his administration's decision to bring Americans with the coronavirus back to U.S. soil. To hear the president tell it, he was directly involved with the decision-making -- … [+2772 chars]

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Fears and confusion surrounding the coronavirus have caused...
articles.description: Fears and confusion surrounding the coronavirus have caused the stock markets to plummet. Chuck Todd says,  “The Dow closed down nearly a thousand points, wiping out most of yesterday's gains. More evidence that Wall Street remains on edge.”

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Seattle Mayor: One of the ways to prevent the spread of...
articles.description: Mayor of Seattle Jenny Durkan says that one of the ways to contain the coronavirus is “social distancing,” which includes telling workers to work from home if they can.
